SEARCH
Package org.etfbl.tks

Class CalculatorAdvanced

java.lang.Object
org.etfbl.tks.Calculator
org.etfbl.tks.CalculatorAdvanced
public class CalculatorAdvanced extends Calculator
An extended calculator class, implementing advanced mathematical operations, such as factorial calculation, exponentiation, calculating the Armstrong and perfect-number properties of accumulator value. For additional information, refer to the Calculator class, linked below.
Since:
2024-11-30
Author:
Ognjen Komadina, ind. 1163/20
See Also:

    Calculates whether the currentValue accumulator value satisfies the following characteristics (based on the value symbol): Armstrong's number: returns true for an N-digit number, if the sum of it's N-powered digits is equal to the number itself.   • Constructor Details

      public CalculatorAdvanced()

  • Method Details

    • calculateAdvanced

      public void calculateAdvanced(char action) throws NotSupportedOperationException, NumberNotInAreaException
      The method performs dual responsibility, calculating the factorial value of currentValue (if the value of action is equal to '!', 0x21), or exponentiation (if the provided value of action is between [0x30, 0x39]).
      Parameters:
      action - The advanced mathematical calculation to be performed (factorial calculation or exponentiation).
      Throws:
      NotSupportedOperationException - If the value of action is not in the range of [0x30, 0x39] or is not equal to the ASCII value of '!' (0x21)
      NumberNotInAreaException - Calculating the factorial value of currentValue is allowed only if the floor-value of it is in the range of [0, 10], otherwise this exception is thrown.

    • hasCharacteristic

      public Boolean hasCharacteristic(char value) throws NotSupportedOperationException, NumberNotInAreaException
      Calculates whether the currentValue accumulator value satisfies the following characteristics (based on the value symbol):
      • Armstrong's number: returns true for an N-digit number, if the sum of it's N-powered digits is equal to the number itself.
      • Perfect number: returns true if the number is equal to the sum of it's common divisors.
      Parameters:
      value - The characteristic symbol, A for Armstrong condition, and P for the perfect number characteristic.
      Returns:
      Boolean logic value, indicating whether the currentValue satisfies the specified characteristic.
      Throws:
      NotSupportedOperationException - If any ASCII symbol for value other than A or P is passed.
      NumberNotInAreaException - If the currentValue mathematical floor value is less than 1 (i.e. it's integer representation).

    • exponent

      public int exponent(int value, int exponent)
      Raises the value parameter to the exponent value, through repeated multiplication. For zero-exponent (i.e. a^0) cases, the return value is equal to the mathematical rules, 0.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to be exponentiated (base).
      exponent - The exponent value.
      Returns:
      Mathematical result of value's exponentiation to the power of exponent.
